title: Mini-Party-Quiches
instructions: 1. Knead the dough ingredients to make a smooth, non-sticky dough. Grease two muffin trays with 12 openings each and distribute the dough in the openings, pressing a small edge. 2. Clean and wash the peppers and leek, peel the onion, chop everything finely and sauté in a pan with a little oil for about 5 minutes. Fill half of the vegetables into a bowl and let cool. 3. Drain the sun-dried tomatoes and cut into small pieces. Dice the ham. Add the tomatoes to one half of the vegetables and the ham to the other half. This way, you'll have 12 mini quiches for ham lovers and 12 for vegetarians. 4. Whisk together the quiche filling ingredients and mix half and half with the vegetables. 5. Place this mixture on the dough in the muffin openings. 6. Bake in a preheated oven at 180 °C (356 °F) for about 20-25 minutes. 7. These mini quiches are great for a cold buffet or as finger food at a party.
